name: NIST 800-171 Rev 3
fullName: NIST Special Publication 800-171 Revision 3 â€” Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information in Nonfederal Systems and Organizations
description: NIST SP 800-171 Rev 3 specifies security requirements for protecting the confidentiality of Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) when it resides in nonfederal systems and organizations. Revision 3 aligns the requirements more closely with NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 and restructures requirements using the 800-53 control family structure. It is the basis for CMMC Level 2 assessments and is mandated by DFARS 252.204-7012 for defense contractors.

certificationDetails.assessor: Self-assessment for DFARS compliance; C3PAO assessment for CMMC Level 2 certification
certificationDetails.auditCycle: Triennial assessment with annual affirmation (aligned with CMMC)
certificationDetails.certificationBody: Cyber AB for CMMC; self-attestation for DFARS standalone

lifecycle.name: Scoping and CUI Identification
lifecycle.description: Identify CUI within the organization, determine system boundaries, and identify applicable security requirements.
keyActivities: Identify CUI data types and flows
Map CUI to storage, processing, and transmission points

lifecycle.name: Gap Assessment
lifecycle.description: Assess current security posture against NIST 800-171 Rev 3 requirements. Determine SPRS score and identify gaps.
keyActivities: Conduct gap analysis against all 17 families

lifecycle.name: SSP and POA&M Development
lifecycle.description: Document system security architecture in the SSP and create POA&M for requirements not yet fully met.

lifecycle.name: Implementation and Remediation
lifecycle.description: Implement security requirements, close POA&M items, and collect evidence of compliance.

lifecycle.name: Assessment and Validation
lifecycle.description: Conduct self-assessment or engage C3PAO for formal assessment. Submit SPRS score to DoD.
keyActivities: Submit SPRS score to SPRS portal

lifecycle.name: Continuous Compliance
lifecycle.description: Maintain compliance through ongoing monitoring, periodic reassessment, and annual affirmation.

domains.name: 03.01 Access Control
domains.description: Limit system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, and devices.

controls.name: Account Management
controls.description: Manage system accounts, including establishing, activating, modifying, reviewing, disabling, and removing accounts. Define conditions for group and role membership.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement account management controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Access Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to systems and information in accordance with applicable access control policies.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement access enforcement controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Information Flow Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of CUI within the system and between connected systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement network segmentation to control CUI flows. Use firewalls, VLANs, and ACLs. Encrypt CUI in transit between trust boundaries. Document all approved information flow paths.

controls.name: Separation of Duties
controls.description: Separate the duties of individuals to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion.
controls.implementationGuidance: Separate administrative functions from operational functions. Ensure no single individual controls all aspects of a critical process. Document duty assignments. Implement technical controls to enforce separation.

controls.name: Least Privilege
controls.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement least privilege controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
controls.description: Enforce a limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a specified time period. Automatically lock the account or node for a specified time period or until released by an administrator.
controls.implementationGuidance: Configure a maximum of 3-5 invalid logon attempts within a 15-minute window. Lock accounts for at least 30 minutes or until administrator intervention. Log all failed logon attempts.

controls.name: System Use Notification
controls.description: Display a system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices.
controls.implementationGuidance: Display use notification before login. Include notice that system is for authorized use only, that monitoring occurs, and that use constitutes consent to monitoring. Obtain user acknowledgment.

controls.name: Device Lock
controls.description: Initiate a device lock after a defined period of inactivity. Retain the device lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.
controls.implementationGuidance: Configure device locks after 15 minutes of inactivity or less. Require reauthentication to unlock. Conceal previous display content. Consider pattern-hiding for mobile devices.

controls.name: Session Termination
controls.description: Automatically terminate a user session after defined conditions or trigger events.
controls.implementationGuidance: Terminate sessions after a defined period of inactivity (15-30 minutes recommended). Terminate sessions upon user logout. Log session termination events.

controls.name: Remote Access
controls.description: Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for remote access. Authorize each type of remote access prior to establishing the connection. Route remote access via managed access control points.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement remote access controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Wireless Access
controls.description: Protect wireless access using authentication and encryption. Authorize each type of wireless access prior to allowing such connections.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement wireless access controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Access Control for Mobile Devices
controls.description: Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for organization-controlled mobile devices. Authorize the connection of mobile devices to organizational systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement access control for mobile devices controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Access Control for Mobile Devices policy documentation
Access Control for Mobile Devices implementation evidence
Access Control for Mobile Devices test records

controls.name: Use of External Systems
controls.description: Establish terms and conditions for authorized use of external systems. Verify that required security controls are implemented on external systems. Limit use of organization-controlled portable storage devices on external systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement use of external systems controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Use of External Systems policy documentation
Use of External Systems implementation evidence
Use of External Systems test records

controls.name: Information Sharing
controls.description: Authorize, document, and control the sharing of CUI with individuals or entities. Enforce information-sharing decisions using automated mechanisms.
controls.implementationGuidance: Document information-sharing agreements. Implement access control mechanisms that enforce sharing decisions. Verify recipient authorization before sharing CUI. Maintain sharing records.

controls.name: Publicly Accessible Content
controls.description: Designate individuals authorized to post information on publicly accessible systems. Review publicly accessible system content for nonpublic information and remove.
controls.implementationGuidance: Designate content reviewers. Review all publicly posted information for CUI or nonpublic information. Remove inappropriate content immediately upon identification. Train designated posters on CUI marking.

controls.name: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
controls.description: Identify specific user actions that can be performed on the system without identification or authentication.
controls.implementationGuidance: Identify and document all actions allowed without authentication. Minimize unauthenticated actions to the minimum necessary. Apply additional monitoring to unauthenticated sessions.

controls.name: Security and Privacy Attributes
controls.description: Provide the means to associate types of security attributes having defined values with information in storage, in process, and in transmission.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define security attribute types and values. Associate attributes with CUI data elements. Implement attribute-based access controls where feasible.

controls.name: Access Control Decisions
controls.description: Enforce access control decisions based on security attributes that are not associated with the individual user.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement attribute-based access control (ABAC) where appropriate. Use security labels, clearance levels, or other attributes for enforcement. Combine with RBAC for defense in depth.

controls.name: Concurrent Session Control
controls.description: Limit the number of concurrent sessions for each system account to a defined number.
controls.implementationGuidance: Limit concurrent sessions to 1-3 per user based on role and risk. Alert on violations. Implement session management controls to enforce limits.

controls.name: CUI Flow Enforcement
controls.description: Use protected mechanism to prevent unauthorized transfer of CUI across trust boundaries.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement data loss prevention (DLP) controls at trust boundaries. Use encryption and access control at CUI storage locations. Monitor and log cross-boundary transfers.

controls.name: Controlled Information on Portable Storage
controls.description: Protect and control organization-controlled CUI on portable storage devices.
controls.implementationGuidance: Encrypt CUI on all portable storage devices. Restrict portable storage to organization-controlled devices. Implement device whitelisting. Disable unauthorized USB devices.

controls.name: Control of Systems Not Identified in SSP
controls.description: Identify and control the use of systems that are not identified in the system security plan.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain current inventory of all systems. Identify unauthorized systems through scanning. Restrict network access for unidentified systems. Include cloud services in scope.

domains.name: 03.02 Awareness and Training
domains.description: Ensure that managers and users of organizational systems are made aware of security risks and are trained to carry out their responsibilities.

controls.name: Literacy Training and Awareness
controls.description: Provide security awareness training to all system users including recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat, social engineering, and phishing.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement literacy training and awareness controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Literacy Training and Awareness policy documentation
Literacy Training and Awareness implementation evidence
Literacy Training and Awareness test records

controls.name: Role-Based Training
controls.description: Provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities before authorizing access and at a defined frequency thereafter.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement role-based training controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Insider Threat Awareness
controls.description: Include practical exercises in literacy training that simulate events and incidents, including insider threats.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement insider threat awareness controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

domains.name: 03.03 Audit and Accountability
domains.description: Create, protect, and retain system audit records to enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting.

controls.name: Event Logging
controls.description: Identify and select events requiring logging. Create, retain, and provide audit logs containing events for after-the-fact investigation of security incidents.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement event logging controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
controls.description: Review and analyze audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity. Report findings to designated officials.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement audit record review, analysis, and reporting controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting policy documentation
Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting implementation evidence
Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting test records

controls.name: Audit Record Generation
controls.description: Provide a system capability to generate audit records. Allow authorized personnel to select events to be logged. Generate audit records for the selected events.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enable audit record generation at the OS, application, and database levels. Maintain synchronized timestamps. Ensure audit records include date, time, user, event type, success/failure, and source.

controls.name: Audit Log Storage Capacity
controls.description: Allocate audit log storage capacity to accommodate the required audit log retention.
controls.implementationGuidance: Calculate storage requirements based on audit volume and retention period. Configure alerting when storage reaches 80% capacity. Plan for log archival and offsite storage.

controls.name: Audit Record Protection
controls.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement audit record protection controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Audit Record Retention
controls.description: Retain audit records for a defined retention period to support after-the-fact investigation and compliance.
controls.implementationGuidance: Retain audit records for a minimum retention period consistent with regulatory and contractual requirements (3+ years recommended for CUI). Archive records for long-term storage.

domains.name: 03.04 Configuration Management
domains.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems throughout their life cycles.

controls.name: Baseline Configuration
controls.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems including hardware, software, firmware, and documentation.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement baseline configuration controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Configuration Settings
controls.description: Establish and enforce security configuration settings for IT products in organizational systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement configuration settings controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Configuration Change Control
controls.description: Track, review, approve or disapprove, and log changes to organizational systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement configuration change control controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Impact Analyses
controls.description: Analyze the security and privacy impact of changes prior to implementation.
controls.implementationGuidance: Establish a change management process that includes security impact analysis. Document potential security impacts. Require approval from security personnel for significant changes.

controls.name: Access Restrictions for Change
controls.description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to organizational systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement logical access controls for configuration changes (e.g., admin-only access to config management tools). Maintain approval records. Enforce change windows.

controls.name: Least Functionality
controls.description: Configure systems to provide only mission-essential capabilities. Restrict, disable, or prevent the use of nonessential programs, functions, ports, protocols, and services.
controls.implementationGuidance: Disable unnecessary services, ports, and protocols. Remove or disable nonessential software. Configure host-based firewalls. Document essential functions and justifications for enabled services.

controls.name: System Component Inventory
controls.description: Develop, document, and maintain a current inventory of system components. Verify that no components are unauthorized.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use automated discovery tools to maintain inventory. Include hardware, software, firmware, and network components. Update within 24 hours of changes. Flag unauthorized components.

controls.name: Software Usage Restrictions
controls.description: Use software and associated documentation in accordance with contract agreements and copyright laws. Track and document licensed use. Control and document the use of peer-to-peer file-sharing technology.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain software license inventory. Audit software compliance quarterly. Remove unlicensed software. Restrict peer-to-peer file sharing.

controls.name: User-Installed Software
controls.description: Control and monitor user-installed software. Enforce software installation policies through automated enforcement.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement application whitelisting where feasible. Require approval for software installation. Monitor for unauthorized software. Scan installed software for vulnerabilities.

domains.name: 03.05 Identification and Authentication
domains.description: Identify and authenticate users of organizational systems and devices before granting access.

controls.name: User Identification and Authentication
controls.description: Identify and authenticate system users, processes, or devices as a prerequisite to allowing access to organizational systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement user identification and authentication controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: User Identification and Authentication policy documentation
User Identification and Authentication implementation evidence
User Identification and Authentication test records

controls.name: Device Identification and Authentication
controls.description: Identify and authenticate devices before establishing a connection.
controls.implementationGuidance: Require device certificates or other authentication mechanism. Authenticate devices before allowing network connections. Implement 802.1X or similar network access control.

controls.name: Identifier Management
controls.description: Manage system identifiers by receiving authorization, selecting appropriate identifier type, assigning the identifier, preventing reuse for a defined period, and disabling after a period of inactivity.
controls.implementationGuidance: Assign unique identifiers to all users. Prevent identifier reuse for 2+ years. Disable identifiers after 90 days of inactivity. Use standard naming conventions.

controls.name: Authenticator Management
controls.description: Manage system authenticators by verifying identity before distributing, establishing initial content, ensuring sufficient strength, changing and refreshing authenticators, protecting authenticator content, and requiring change when compromised.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use complex passwords (15+ characters) or passphrases. Protect authenticator content from unauthorized disclosure. Change authenticators upon evidence of compromise. Use approved authenticator types.

controls.name: Authentication Feedback
controls.description: Obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process.
controls.implementationGuidance: Display asterisks or dots instead of actual characters during password entry. Do not echo authentication information in error messages.

controls.name: Cryptographic Module Authentication
controls.description: Employ FIPS-validated cryptographic modules for all authentication mechanisms.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use FIPS 140-2/140-3 validated cryptographic modules. Verify validation certificates. Ensure all authentication-related cryptographic operations use validated modules.

controls.name: Non-Organizational User Identification and Authentication
controls.description: Identify and authenticate non-organizational users accessing the system.
controls.implementationGuidance: Authenticate external users with the same rigor as internal users. Use federated identity solutions where appropriate. Implement appropriate access restrictions for external users.

controls.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
controls.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement multi-factor authentication controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Replay-Resistant Authentication
controls.description: Implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use authentication protocols resistant to replay attacks (e.g., challenge-response, time-based tokens). Avoid authentication mechanisms susceptible to interception and reuse.

controls.name: Identity Proofing
controls.description: Verify identity of individuals, validate documentation, and resolve identity before issuing credentials for access to organizational systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Verify identity through acceptable documents (government-issued ID). Conduct identity proofing in person or via approved remote methods. Maintain proofing records.

controls.name: Re-authentication
controls.description: Require users to re-authenticate when specified conditions are met including role change, session timeout, or privilege escalation.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define re-authentication triggers including session timeout, privilege escalation, and accessing high-sensitivity CUI. Enforce re-authentication for critical actions.

domains.name: 03.06 Incident Response
domains.description: Establish an operational incident handling capability for organizational systems.

controls.name: Incident Handling
controls.description: Implement an incident handling capability that includes preparation, detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement incident handling controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Incident Monitoring and Reporting
controls.description: Track, document, and report incidents to designated officials and external authorities. Monitor and analyze indicators of compromise.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement incident monitoring and reporting controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Incident Monitoring and Reporting policy documentation
Incident Monitoring and Reporting implementation evidence
Incident Monitoring and Reporting test records

controls.name: Incident Response Testing
controls.description: Test the organizational incident response capability at a defined frequency.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct tabletop exercises or functional tests annually at minimum. Test incident response procedures for CUI-related incidents. Document test results and lessons learned.

domains.name: 03.07 Maintenance
domains.description: Perform timely maintenance on organizational systems and provide controls for maintenance tools and personnel.

controls.name: System Maintenance
controls.description: Perform maintenance on organizational systems. Provide controls on the tools, techniques, mechanisms, and personnel used to conduct maintenance.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement system maintenance controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Maintenance Tools
controls.description: Inspect maintenance tools, test media with malicious code checks, and check equipment for unauthorized modifications prior to use.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement maintenance tools controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Nonlocal Maintenance
controls.description: Require multi-factor authentication and encrypt sessions for nonlocal maintenance activities. Terminate remote sessions when complete.
controls.implementationGuidance: Encrypt all remote maintenance sessions. Use VPN with multi-factor authentication. Monitor all remote maintenance activities. Log all remote maintenance sessions.

controls.name: Maintenance Personnel
controls.description: Establish a process for maintenance personnel authorization. Verify that authorized maintenance personnel possess required access authorizations. Supervise maintenance activities of personnel who do not possess required access.
controls.implementationGuidance: Verify maintenance personnel qualifications. Require escort for uncleared maintenance staff. Monitor all maintenance activities. Maintain maintenance personnel access records.

controls.name: Timely Maintenance
controls.description: Obtain maintenance support and spare parts for system components within a defined time period.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain spare parts inventory. Establish maintenance support agreements. Define maximum acceptable downtime. Prioritize critical system components.

controls.name: Controlled Maintenance
controls.description: Ensure equipment removed for off-site maintenance is sanitized of any CUI.
controls.implementationGuidance: Sanitize all CUI from equipment before off-site maintenance. Verify sanitization before release. Use secure transport methods. Maintain chain of custody records.

domains.name: 03.08 Media Protection
domains.description: Protect information system media, both paper and digital, containing CUI.

controls.name: Media Protection
controls.description: Protect system media containing CUI, both paper and digital. Limit access to CUI on system media to authorized users. Sanitize or destroy system media before disposal or release.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement media protection controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Media Access
controls.description: Restrict access to digital and non-digital media containing CUI to authorized personnel.
controls.implementationGuidance: Restrict physical access to media storage areas. Implement access logging for media storage. Use locked containers for removable media. Sign out media for use.

controls.name: Media Marking
controls.description: Mark media with necessary CUI markings and distribution limitations.
controls.implementationGuidance: Apply CUI marking banner and category. Include distribution limitations. Mark both digital and physical media. Follow 32 CFR Part 2002 marking requirements.

controls.name: Media Storage
controls.description: Physically control and securely store digital and non-digital media containing CUI.
controls.implementationGuidance: Store CUI media in controlled access areas. Use approved encryption for digital media. Use locked containers for physical media. Maintain media inventory.

controls.name: Media Transport
controls.description: Protect and control digital and non-digital media during transport outside controlled areas. Maintain accountability for media during transport.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use authorized couriers for transport. Encrypt digital media in transit. Maintain chain of custody documentation. Use tamper-evident packaging.

controls.name: Media Sanitization
controls.description: Sanitize system media containing CUI prior to disposal, release, or reuse using NIST SP 800-88 guidelines. Use approved sanitization equipment and procedures.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement media sanitization controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Media Use
controls.description: Restrict the use of certain types of digital media on organizational systems. Prohibit the use of portable storage devices when such devices have no identifiable owner.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement device control software. Block unauthorized removable media. Maintain an approved media device list. Monitor for policy violations.

controls.name: CUI on Mobile Devices
controls.description: Protect CUI stored on mobile devices and removable media through encryption and physical safeguards.
controls.implementationGuidance: Require full-disk encryption on mobile devices. Implement remote wipe capability. Use containerization for CUI on mobile devices. Enforce mobile device management policies.

controls.name: Media Disposal
controls.description: Ensure CUI is unrecoverable from disposed media through proper destruction or sanitization techniques.
controls.implementationGuidance: Follow NIST SP 800-88 guidelines for media sanitization. Use cross-cut shredders for paper media. Degauss or destroy magnetic media. Maintain destruction records.

domains.name: 03.09 Personnel Security
domains.description: Ensure that individuals occupying positions of responsibility are trustworthy and meet security criteria.

controls.name: Personnel Screening
controls.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to systems containing CUI. Rescreen at a defined frequency.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement personnel screening controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Personnel Termination and Transfer
controls.description: Protect CUI during and after personnel actions such as terminations and transfers. Disable system access within a defined period of termination. Retrieve all CUI and system-related property. Conduct exit interviews.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement personnel termination and transfer controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Personnel Termination and Transfer policy documentation
Personnel Termination and Transfer implementation evidence
Personnel Termination and Transfer test records

controls.name: External Personnel Security
controls.description: Establish personnel security requirements for third-party providers. Monitor provider compliance. Require providers to notify organization of personnel transfers or terminations.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement external personnel security controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

domains.name: 03.10 Physical Protection
domains.description: Limit physical access to organizational systems, equipment, and operating environments.

controls.name: Physical Access Authorizations
controls.description: Develop and maintain lists of authorized personnel with physical access.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain current access lists. Review and update quarterly. Include visitor authorization procedures. Coordinate with HR for personnel changes.

controls.name: Physical Access Control
controls.description: Control and manage physical access to organizational systems by verifying individual access authorizations before granting access. Control access through physical access devices.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use badge readers, biometrics, or cipher locks. Implement mantrap or vestibule for high-security areas. Control keys and access codes. Log all physical access.

controls.name: Monitoring Physical Access
controls.description: Monitor the physical facility and infrastructure for unauthorized physical access. Review physical access logs at a defined frequency.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement monitoring physical access controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Visitor Management
controls.description: Escort visitors, monitor visitor activity, and maintain visitor access records.
controls.implementationGuidance: Require visitor sign-in. Escort visitors in controlled areas. Verify visitor identity. Maintain visitor logs for a defined retention period.

controls.name: Alternate Work Sites
controls.description: Enforce security measures at alternate work sites.
controls.implementationGuidance: Extend security controls to home offices and alternate sites. Require VPN and encrypted storage. Conduct security reviews of alternate sites.

controls.name: Delivery and Removal
controls.description: Enforce safeguards to control CUI during equipment delivery and removal.
controls.implementationGuidance: Inspect equipment upon delivery. Verify equipment against purchase orders. Sanitize equipment before removal. Maintain delivery and removal records.

domains.name: 03.11 Risk Assessment
domains.description: Assess risk to organizational operations, assets, and individuals from the operation and use of organizational systems.

controls.name: Risk Assessment
controls.description: Assess risk to organizational operations, organizational assets, and individuals resulting from operation of organizational systems and the processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement risk assessment controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning
controls.description: Scan for vulnerabilities in organizational systems at a defined frequency and when new vulnerabilities are identified. Remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with risk assessments.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement vulnerability monitoring and scanning controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning policy documentation
Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning implementation evidence
Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning test records

controls.name: Risk Response
controls.description: Respond to findings from security assessments, monitoring, and audits in accordance with organizational risk tolerance.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement risk response controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

domains.name: 03.12 Security Assessment
domains.description: Periodically assess security controls, develop and implement plans of action, and monitor corrective actions.

controls.name: Security Assessment
controls.description: Assess security controls at a defined frequency to determine whether controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement security assessment controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Plan of Action and Milestones
controls.description: Develop and implement POA&Ms for the system to document planned remedial actions. Update existing POA&Ms based on assessment findings.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement plan of action and milestones controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Plan of Action and Milestones policy documentation
Plan of Action and Milestones implementation evidence
Plan of Action and Milestones test records

controls.name: Continuous Monitoring
controls.description: Develop and implement a system-level continuous monitoring strategy. Utilize ongoing assessments to verify compliance.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement continuous monitoring controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: System Interconnections
controls.description: Authorize and monitor connections to organizational systems including the use of interconnection security agreements.
controls.implementationGuidance: Document all system interconnections. Implement interconnection security agreements (ISAs). Monitor interconnection traffic. Review and update agreements annually.

domains.name: 03.13 System and Communications Protection
domains.description: Monitor, control, and protect communications at system boundaries and key internal boundaries.

controls.name: Boundary Protection
controls.description: Monitor, control, and protect communications at external and key internal boundaries. Implement subnetworks for components with specific security requirements.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement boundary protection controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity
controls.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and detect changes to CUI during transmission.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement transmission confidentiality and integrity controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity policy documentation
Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity implementation evidence
Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity test records

controls.name: Network Disconnect
controls.description: Terminate network connections associated with communications sessions at the end of the sessions or after a defined period of inactivity.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement network disconnect controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Cryptographic Key Management
controls.description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys using approved key management technology and processes.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement cryptographic key management controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: Implement FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement cryptographic protection controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Collaborative Computing Devices
controls.description: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and provide an explicit indication of use to users at the device.
controls.implementationGuidance: Disable cameras and microphones when not in use. Provide visual/audible indicator of activation. Require user action to enable. Block remote activation.

controls.name: Public Key Certificates
controls.description: Issue public key certificates under an appropriate certificate policy or obtain them from an approved service provider.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use PKI certificates from approved certificate authorities. Follow certificate lifecycle management. Revoke compromised certificates immediately.

controls.name: Mobile Code
controls.description: Control and monitor the use of mobile code. Establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance.
controls.implementationGuidance: Block unauthorized mobile code. Implement mobile code policies. Use sandboxing for mobile code execution. Monitor mobile code activity.

controls.name: Secure Name Resolution
controls.description: Provide secure, authoritative name resolution. Perform data origin authentication and data integrity verification on name resolution responses.
controls.implementationGuidance: Configure DNSSEC. Use trusted DNS resolvers. Implement DNS filtering. Monitor DNS queries for anomalies.

controls.name: Session Authenticity
controls.description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement TLS 1.2 or higher. Use session tokens with expiration. Protect against session hijacking. Implement CSRF protections.

controls.name: Protection of Information at Rest
controls.description: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of CUI at rest. Employ cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement protection of information at rest controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Protection of Information at Rest policy documentation
Protection of Information at Rest implementation evidence
Protection of Information at Rest test records

controls.name: Separation of System and User Functionality
controls.description: Separate user functionality from system management functionality.
controls.implementationGuidance: Separate admin interfaces from user interfaces. Restrict management functionality to authorized administrators. Use separate network segments for management.

controls.name: Shared System Resources
controls.description: Prevent unauthorized transfer of information via shared system resources.
controls.implementationGuidance: Clear shared resources between users. Implement memory protection. Prevent data remnants in shared storage. Use separate virtual environments.

controls.name: Denial-of-Service Protection
controls.description: Protect against or limit the effects of denial-of-service attacks.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement rate limiting and throttling. Use load balancers and CDNs. Deploy WAF rules for application-layer attacks. Monitor for DoS patterns.

controls.name: Process Isolation
controls.description: Maintain a separate execution domain for each executing system process.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use process isolation mechanisms provided by the OS. Implement containerization where appropriate. Use separate address spaces for processes.

domains.name: 03.14 System and Information Integrity
domains.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws in a timely manner. Protect against malicious code. Monitor system security alerts.

controls.name: Flaw Remediation
controls.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws in a timely manner. Test software and firmware updates for effectiveness and potential side effects before installation. Install security-relevant updates within a defined time period.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement flaw remediation controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Malicious Code Protection
controls.description: Implement mechanisms to detect and eradicate malicious code. Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available. Perform scans at a defined frequency and on files from external sources.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement malicious code protection controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Security Alerts and Advisories
controls.description: Receive security alerts, advisories, and directives from designated external organizations on an ongoing basis. Generate internal security alerts and distribute to appropriate personnel.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement security alerts and advisories controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Security Alerts and Advisories policy documentation
Security Alerts and Advisories implementation evidence
Security Alerts and Advisories test records

controls.name: System Monitoring
controls.description: Monitor the system to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks. Monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic for unusual or unauthorized activities.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement system monitoring controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Input Validation
controls.description: Check the validity of security-relevant inputs. Identify potentially harmful inputs and handle appropriately.
controls.implementationGuidance: Validate all input fields for type, length, format, and range. Sanitize inputs to prevent injection attacks. Implement both client-side and server-side validation. Reject invalid inputs.

controls.name: Error Handling
controls.description: Generate error messages that provide information necessary for corrective actions without revealing information that could be exploited.
controls.implementationGuidance: Display generic error messages to users. Log detailed error information securely. Do not expose stack traces, database queries, or internal paths. Implement custom error pages.

controls.name: Software and Information Integrity
controls.description: Employ integrity verification tools to detect unauthorized changes to software, firmware, and information. Detect and address unauthorized changes.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement file integrity monitoring (FIM). Verify software checksums against vendor-published values. Use code signing for internally developed software. Alert on integrity violations.

domains.name: 03.15 Planning
domains.description: Develop, document, periodically update, and implement security plans for organizational systems.

controls.name: System Security Plan
controls.description: Develop, document, periodically update, and implement system security plans that describe system boundaries, operating environment, how security requirements are implemented, and relationships with other systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement system security plan controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Rules of Behavior
controls.description: Establish and implement rules of behavior for individuals accessing the system. Include restrictions on use of social media, posting organizational information on public websites, and use of personal devices.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement rules of behavior controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

domains.name: 03.16 System and Services Acquisition
domains.description: Ensure third-party providers protect CUI in external systems and services.

controls.name: Security Engineering Principles
controls.description: Apply systems security engineering principles in the specification, design, development, implementation, and modification of the system.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement security engineering principles controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: External System Services
controls.description: Require external service providers to comply with organizational security requirements and employ appropriate security controls.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement external system services controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

controls.name: Developer Security Testing
controls.description: Require developers of the system to create a security assessment plan and implement a process for flaw remediation.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement developer security testing controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.

domains.name: 03.17 Supply Chain Risk Management
domains.description: Manage supply chain risks for systems, components, and services.

controls.name: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan
controls.description: Develop a plan for managing supply chain risks associated with the development, acquisition, maintenance, and disposal of systems, system components, and system services.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement supply chain risk management plan controls as required. Document implementation. Collect and maintain evidence of compliance.
evidenceRequired: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan policy documentation
Supply Chain Risk Management Plan implementation evidence
Supply Chain Risk Management Plan test records

controls.name: Acquisition Strategies and Tools
controls.description: Employ acquisition strategies, contract tools, and procurement methods designed to protect against, detect, and mitigate supply chain risks.
controls.implementationGuidance: Include security requirements in contracts. Verify supplier security practices. Use trusted procurement channels. Require supply chain risk information from suppliers.

controls.name: Component Authenticity
controls.description: Employ anti-counterfeit techniques. Develop and maintain an approved list of authorized suppliers.
controls.implementationGuidance: Inspect and verify components. Use anti-counterfeit tools. Maintain approved supplier lists. Report suspected counterfeits to authorities.

breachNotification.timeframe: 72 hours to DoD via DIBNet portal for defense contractors
breachNotification.notifyAuthority: DoD Cyber Crime Center (DC3) via DIBNet; CISA for non-DoD CUI
breachNotification.threshold: Any cyber incident affecting CUI or the covered contractor information system
